channel.title: im getting this error whn im trying to open tor
channel.description:
ERROR: User home folder permission issue?
Failed to run the following command:
cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.tb/tor-browser /home/user/.tb/tor-browser
Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate. That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Root#Inappropriate_Use_of_Root_Rights
To fix this, you could try: Start Menu -> System -> Xfce Terminal
sudo chown --recursive "user":"user" "/home/user"
Then try starting Tor Browser again.
To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Verbose_Mode.
See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Permission_Issues
I used this command but nothing happend sudo chown --recursive "user":"user" "/home/user"

item.title: im getting this error whn im trying to open tor
item.dc:creator: Samuzayn3
item.description:
ERROR: User home folder permission issue?

Failed to run the following command:

cp --verbose --recursive --no-clobber /var/cache/tb-binary/.tb/tor-browser /home/user/.tb/tor-browser

Tip: If something does not work, do not arbitrarily try to use sudo / root without indication that this would be appropriate.
That only risks messing up user home folder permissions. See:

Whonix – 30 Sep 21

Safely Use Root Commands

Tips on using sudo / root (privileged) commands safely

To fix this, you could try:
Start Menu → System → Xfce Terminal

sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”

Then try starting Tor Browser again.

To debug this, you could try to start Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) from command line in:
Tor Browser Essentials.

See also Tor Browser Starter (by Whonix developers) Permission Issues:

Whonix – 30 Sep 21

Tor Browser Essentials

Using Tor Browser in Whonix ™. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update Tor Browser, Browser Plugins, Change Language

I used this command but nothing happend
sudo chown --recursive “user”:“user” “/home/user”

Read full topic
